title: Fork, 1985-103-37, 1650–1700
creditline: The Robert L. Metzenberg Collection, gift of Eleanor L. Metzenberg
description: Long two-tined fork, decorated at the inside of the rounded shoulders; short baluster stem. Tapered wooden handle of oval section with beaked end; handle divided latually by bands of laminated horn, silver, gold; handle piqué and inlaid with rozettes and dots of different metals. Rozette on flat end.

exhibitions.title: Feeding Desire: Design and the Tools of the Table, 1500-2005
